Eigenchannels: 1: Eigenchannels, method from Paulsson and Brandbyge PRB 2007 2: Calculate “bond” currents

Inelastica.EigenChannels.GetOptions(argv, **kwargs)[source]¶
Inelastica.EigenChannels.calcCurrent(options, basis, H, Y)[source]¶

Calculate current density in atomic bonds Y : complex scattering state or Y : A_l or A_r! (for total current)

Inelastica.EigenChannels.calcWF(options, geom, basis, Y)[source]¶

Calculate wavefunction, returns: YY : complex wavefunction on regular grid dstep : stepsize origo : vector nx, ny, nz : number of grid points

Inelastica.EigenChannels.fileName(options)[source]¶
Inelastica.EigenChannels.main(options)[source]¶
Inelastica.EigenChannels.writeCurrent(options, geom, Curr)[source]¶

Write bond currents to file fn : Filename Curr : Bond current matrix

Inelastica.EigenChannels.writeWavefunction(options, geom, basis, Y, fn=None)[source]¶

Writes wave function to the specified output type Y: vector for wavefunction

Inelastica.EigenChannels.writeXSF(geom, fn, YY, nx, ny, nz, origo, dstep)[source]¶

Write XSF datagrid for XCrysden

Inelastica.EigenChannels.writecube(geom, fn, YY, nx, ny, nz, origo, dstep)[source]¶

Write wavefunction to cube file.

Inelastica.EigenChannels.writemacubin(fn, YY, nx, ny, nz, origo, dstep)[source]¶

Write molekel binary format

Inelastica.EigenChannels.writenetcdf(geom, fn, YY, nx, ny, nz, origo, dstep)[source]¶

THF: Write eigenchannels to netcdf format
